title: Deathfire Touch or Thunderlord's Decree, when and who?
body:
Do I go Deathfire on Assassins and Thunderlord's on AOE mages as a rule of thumb? I'm just running Deathfire's on everyone at the moment but I'm not sure it's the best since AOE spells get half the effect from it.

Thoughts?

replies.body:
Every single spell you land increases the scaling output total of Deathfire by 0.1 or 0.2 for single target within 30 seconds - compared to Thunderlord's.

So while Thunderlords might go 10-180 flat damage and Deathfire sits at 6 (3 for AOE) - within a team fight you can essentially as Ahri hit a Q on 5 people and have it apply 0.5 (That's a huge ratio) of your AP as DoT [3 seconds]).

So like Thunderlord's might seem good, but once you're hitting 600 AP and poke 5 people for 0.5 of your AP that's 300 Damage over time total which far exceeds Thunderlord's which is once every 30 seconds. Personally I take Thunderlord's on support annie because of her auto-Q-Auto gaining a per level boost with a proc used to zone each wave and because the other 2 cunning tree masteries aren't really good for her, one is useless as she doesnt rlly heal or shield people and Stormraiders doesnt really seem necessary or useful.

Poke 5 people twice within 30 seconds and you've done 1:1 AP Ratio as Damage over time whereas Thunderlord's only applies in a tiny AOE and is 10-180 plus .2 of your Bonus AD and .1 of your total AP so, bearing in mind for single target spells like Ahri's W (Multi-hit single target) it is applying a 1:0.2 ratio so if you land a few of these during a fight (within 30 seconds) that's 10 Q's and 2 x3 W's which is 0.6:1 (W) plus 1:1 (10 Q's) of your AP as a bleed (1.6 AP Ratio as a bleed effect) and with a 7 second base CD on your Q and 5 second base CD on your W you can easily exceed this within 30 seconds.

Come late game that's 1.6K Bleed which is 10x as good as Thunderlord's (No exaggeration). Plus it's not limited to a tiny area around 1 target but applies on your spells.

So while you might be happy with a proc every 30 seconds, you never know when fights will start and when they do - having a huge bleed effect far exceeds having a nice keystone until having deathfire would have exceeded it in usefulness by 10 or even 20 times.

Deathfire is actually just straight up shit, it's designed for poke mages really, but even then they are better off going elsewhere.

Deathfire: 6 + 50% BAD + 20% AP

Thunderlords: 10-180 (scales by level) + 20% BAD + 10% AP in an AoE

Given how most games are about snowballing, Thunderlords is vastly superior.
Sure but Thunderlord's has a 30 sec cooldown and requires you to hit three spells/autos before it procs.

Yes because being able to have a massive out trade once every wave isn't massive.

Also just as a note, it's 3 procs of spell damage.

For example, Anivia Q will proc with the Q hitting, and again with the stun meaning an Anivia Q+Q stun+E = thunderlord's

The same sort of thing exists for leblanc (E>Q>Proc Q) and several other champions.

I've switched already :P

And I was watching Phreak talk about this and he said that it doesn't count DoT damage like Brand's Passive, or Cass poison. He emphasized that you have to HIT three spells/autos. Still not 100% sure though, I haven't played a game with it yet.

Yes but it does depend on the DoT, for example, Morg W will trigger all 3 hits if they stay on it. (tried that earlier, in fact i am going to be trying several champions with this)

That being said, Brand and Cass still have extremely reliable ways of popping it (Cass Q/W>E>E, Brand W/E>Q>AA)

Oh cool! Although I'd probably still run Deathfire Touch on Cassiopeia since her E lets her have the full effect from it and with the amount of E's you're gonna be throwing out (I'd be too lazy to do the Math) you'll probably end up doing more damage with Deathfire's in 30 seconds than you could with one proc of Thunderlord's

Honestly procing it with E's would be too expensive for her mana pool at any time outside late game.

And cass is probably the only outlier for whether she want's this or not, and she could still fairly well be argued for having thunderlord's for the fact that it means you trade once per wave then use the wave to keep your mana pool up and harass next wave.

I mean for Cass until you can get your 500 stacks on the passive, thunderlord's is probably better unless your putting a massive strain on her mana pool.
Oh no I meant just in a fight in general. Where she would be E-ing all the time anyway.
Current patch you need to have snowballed before actual fighting.
I mean I wouldn't be playing Cass in this patch in the first place, but you get the jist
really? the bloody teemo 1 aa does it

Another thing about Deathfire Touch is that you need som good amount of AP to get use of it, and statistically games time has been reduced, so getting lots of AP can be hard. That's why overall Thunderlord's is probably better.

AP you need to outscale actually also increases extremely fast depending on how often you are trading.

Unless you consistently have the enemy under the deathfire effect for the whole 30 seconds of Thunderlords being down, Thunderlords tends to be better, once about level 6 is hit (the major power spike for mid laners in general)
corki e aa is insta burst (his aa stack 2 parts of it)
forgot that deathfire is 1/2 for aoe spells (which most champs are)

Need to consider that Deathfire Touch has no cd whereas Thunderlord's Decree's is 30 seconds.

Me thinks that Thunderlord is better for upfront burst while Deathfire is better in the long run.

but consider. at level 6 most people would get around 60-80 damage off thunder lord every 30 sec, considering that the deathfire takes 3 sec to do damage (or 1.5 sec for 1/2 on aoe spells) the player would have to constantly throw AND HIT spells to even attempt to keep up with the lighting 1. so where as 60-80 bonus at lv 6, compared to needing to constantly hit spells for 30 seconds to try match thunderlord, you would only do around 62 damage considering (without 1 spell missed, with a constant burn from it)
YES! I was immediately gonna put point's into Thunderlord's but then that crossed my mind.

Deathfire isn't really that good. Basically, how you want to choose your masteries is look at all nine of the keystones, and decide which one you want. Don't put points into a tree if you want say more damage or something and then just deal with a sub par keystone at the end. Pick which keystone you want, then get it, then put the points elsewhere. So for an AP mage, if I was burst I would grab the Keystone that lets me get MoveSpeed when I chunk someone, and put the rest of my points into ferocity for some more damage. If I was an immobile mage, I would grab Thunderlord's Decree and put the rest of my points into resolve to grab some movespeed and grab the CDR on my summoner spells.
This is actually how I did it. I'm just not sure on whether Deathfire's or Thunderlord's is stronger. I'm not a huge fan of the movespeed keystone in general but yes I see where you're going with it.

most speed is good on assassins like talon who have no other means of escape after assassination (his ewq combo in lane even at lv 3 is usually enough to proc the ms keystone anyway, so you can trade and not take that much return damage).
I was just using an example. It would be useful as someone like LeBlanc who after bursting needs some time for CD to run out and can stick to them or get away (somewhat) safely.
Yeah I know you were man haha but yes I do see the point in it. I'd run it on someone like Talon or Diana, you can just W back out with Leblanc.
thunderlord is the only "good" keystone on tf (w stun + q kills most adc cuz of it (w procs it twice, then q finishes it))
